page.title: 01TEDSTONE DELAMERE DISTRICT
page.content: This is a rural area on the borders of Herefordshire & Worcestershire 5 miles from Bromyard & 12 miles from Worcester. To the North is the large village of Clifton-upon-Teme and to the South the village of Whitbourne, where Post Offices, shops, butchers, Doctors' surgeries, garages and petrol are available. Two ridges of fertile farmland are divided by the steep sided valley of the Sapey Brook which joins the River Teme above Knightsford Bridge. The highest point is 600 ft at Moorsfield. The major part of the land is used for grazing and much is arable interspersed with cared for woodland and coverts. Tedstone Delamere is the main parish with a 700 yr old church of St James. Hunting & shooting are chief recreations with other interests catered for in nearby villages.
